species_list.name: Kel Dor
species_list.description_general: Evolved on Dorin (helium & unique gas atmosphere), Kel Dor need antiox breath masks and protective goggles off-world. Masks include vocoders. Calm and kind, believe in quick, simple justice. Skin peach to deep red, black eyes. Average 1.6 to 2m tall. Homeworld: Dorin. Adventurers are often diplomats, bounty hunters, or Jedi. [Source: CRB p.29]

special_qualities.name: Keen Force Sense
special_qualities.description: Kel Dor may choose to reroll any Use the Force check made to search their feelings or sense the Force, keeping the better of the two results. [CRB p.29]

special_qualities.name: Low-Light Vision
special_qualities.description: Kel Dor ignore concealment (but not total concealment) from darkness. [CRB p.29]

effects.details: Ignores concealment (but not total concealment) from darkness.

special_qualities.name: Special Equipment (Goggles and Mask Requirement)
special_qualities.description: Require protective goggles (without, considered blind) and an antiox breath mask (without, begins to suffocate). Replacement mask 2,000cr (500 on Dorin), year's filters 200cr (50 on Dorin). Start with these at no cost. Antiox mask poisonous to other species. [CRB p.29, cite: 166-167]

effects.starting_equipment_note: Begins play with these items at no cost.
effects.additional_note: Antiox breath mask is poisonous to other species.

species_list.name: Kerkoiden
species_list.description_general: Kerkoiden are a lean, lupine humanoid species known for their cunning and pack-based social structures. They are agile hunters and trackers, often possessing a keen predatory instinct. Kerkoiden society values strength, loyalty, and strategy, and they are often found in military or scouting roles. [Web Source: Based on general Star Wars species information, often found in expanded universe materials and fan compilations like Wookieepedia.]

special_qualities.name: Predator's Heritage
special_qualities.description: You gain a +2 species bonus on damage rolls against a target that has been damaged since the beginning of your last turn.

special_qualities.name: Social Cunning
special_qualities.description: You may use your WIS bonus in the place of your CHA bonus for determining your skill bonus on Deception and Persuasion.

species_list.name: Khil
species_list.description_general: The Khil are a humanoid species from the planet Belnar, distinguished by their drooping jowls and wrinkled skin, giving them a mournful appearance. They possess a unique biological trait allowing them to derive sustenance from ambient microorganisms. Khil society is known for its cooperative spirit and emphasis on community, making them dependable workers and allies. [Web Source: Wookieepedia]

special_qualities.name: Cooperative Spirit
special_qualities.description: As a swift action you can aid adjacent allies or vice-versa on skill checks with the following skills: Climb, Endurance, Gather Information, Jump, Knowledge, Mechanics, Pilot, Ride, Survival, Swim, Treat Injury or Use Computer

effects.effect_description: Aid adjacent allies (or be aided by them) on checks with specified skills.

special_qualities.name: Dependable Worker
special_qualities.description: Once per encounter, a Khil can treat one skill check with certain skills [detailed below) as though he or she had taken 10, even after the roll has been made (but before the result of the check is known). The Khil may only use this ability on checks with one of the following skills: Climb, Endurance, Gather Information, Jump, Knowledge [any), Mechanics, Pilot, Ride, Survival, Swim, Treat Injury, or Use Computer.

effects.effect_description: Treat one skill check (from specified list) as if Take 10 was used, even after roll is made but before result is known.

special_qualities.name: Hullepi
special_qualities.description: You do not suffer the effects of starvation, except in a sterile environment

species_list.name: Killik
species_list.description_general: Killiks are an intelligent insectoid species native to Alderaan, later migrating to the Unknown Regions. They exist as a collective hive mind, with individual identity being secondary to the Nest. Killiks are known for their ability to absorb other species into their hive as 'Joiners' through pheromonal and telepathic means. They possess natural armor, claws, and a complex social structure. [Web Source: Wookieepedia]

special_qualities.name: Hive Mind
special_qualities.description: When you are within 1 kilometre of another Killik you can communicate via telepathy

special_qualities.name: Joiners
special_qualities.description: Whenever a Killik reduces a living creature with an Intelligence of 3 or higher to 0 hit points, or the Killik knocks the creature unconscious by moving it down the condition track, the Killik can transform the target into a Joiner. The target must be helpless for this to occur. The process takes 1 minute and exposes the target to mind-altering pheromones. Once the target becomes a Joiner, its attitude shifts to friendly to the Killik and its allies, and the target gains a +10 bonus to Will Defense against attempts to use Persuasion to alter its perceptions of its new Killik friends. A target transformed into a Joiner in this manner can make a DC 20 Intelligence check once per day to remove the effect and return to its original attitude. This is a mind-affecting effect.

special_qualities.name: Low-Light Vision
special_qualities.description: You ignore concealment (but not total concealment) from darkness

effects.details: Ignores concealment (but not total concealment) from darkness.

special_qualities.name: Multiple Limbs
special_qualities.description: When making multiple attacks, reduce the penalty to your attack rolls by 2

special_qualities.name: Natural Armor
special_qualities.description: You gain a +1 natural armor bonus to your Reflex Defense

special_qualities.name: Natural Weapons (Claws)
special_qualities.description: When you make an unarmed attack, you may choose to use your claws, dealing 1d6 slashing damage

species_list.name: Kissai
species_list.description_general: The Kissai are a priestly caste of the ancient Sith species, known for their affinity with the dark side of the Force and their expertise in Sith alchemy and sorcery. They possess a strong hierarchical society, often serving as advisors and scholars to Sith Lords. Kissai are typically characterized by their sharp features, ceremonial attire, and deep connection to Sith traditions. [Web Source: Wookieepedia, based on Sith Pureblood lore relating to castes.]

special_qualities.name: Inspired
special_qualities.description: When you receive a morale or insight bonus from any source, the bonus increases by 1

special_qualities.name: Warrior's Awareness
special_qualities.description: Once/encounter as a reaction you can gain the benefit of the Uncanny Dodge 1 and Uncanny Dodge 2 talents until the beginning of your next turn

special_qualities.name: Weapon Familiarity (Lanvarok)
special_qualities.description: You treat the lanvarok as a simple weapon instead of an exotic weapon

species_list.name: Klatoonian
species_list.description_general: Klatoonians are a humanoid species from the planet Klatooine, known for their strong adherence to tradition and their historical servitude to the Hutts. They are physically robust, with leathery skin and a reputation for being stubborn and unimaginative, yet dependable. Klatoonian culture revolves around ancient pacts and a deep respect for their elders and history. [Web Source: Wookieepedia]

special_qualities.name: Species Bonus to Will Defense
special_qualities.description: Gains a +2 species bonus to Will Defense.

species_list.name: Krevaaki
species_list.description_general: The Krevaaki are a sturdy, insectoid species with a tough carapace and grasping tentacles. They are known for their stoic demeanor, making them difficult to read emotionally. Krevaaki are often skilled climbers due to their tentacles and are adapted to harsh environments. Their culture and homeworld details are less commonly known in the wider galaxy. [Web Source: Based on common insectoid species tropes and provided traits.]

special_qualities.name: Carapace
special_qualities.description: Krevaaki gain a +1 natural armor bonus to Reflex Defense and a +1 natural armor bonus to Fortitude Defense. A natural armor bonus stacks with an armor bonus.

special_qualities.name: Conditional Bonus Feat
special_qualities.description: You gain Skill Focus (Climb) as a bonus feat if you are trained in the Climb skill

special_qualities.name: Grasping Tentacles
special_qualities.description: You gain a +2 species bonus on Climb checks and +2 species bonus on grapple checks

special_qualities.name: Stoic
special_qualities.description: Any creature attempting to use the Sense Motive application of the Perception skill on you takes a -5 penalty on the skill check

They are known for their stoic demeanor, making them difficult to read emotionally. Krevaaki are often skilled climbers due to their tentacles and are adapted to harsh environments. species_list.name: Lugubraa
species_list.description_general: Lugubraa are a bulky, strong, and physically resilient species characterized by their unique life cycle which includes a significant intellectual development around middle age. Younger Lugubraa tend to be less intelligent. They possess natural weapons like barbed tentacles and formidable teeth, with a 'lockbite' ability. [Web Source: Based on provided traits; specific lore details are scarce in common fan wikis.]

special_qualities.name: Bonus Feat
special_qualities.description: You gain Improved Damage Threshold as a bonus feat

special_qualities.name: Darkvision
special_qualities.description: You ignore concealment (including total concealment) from darkness

effects.details: Ignores concealment (including total concealment) from darkness.

special_qualities.name: Lockbite
special_qualities.description: If you make a successful grapple attack you can automatically latch onto the target with your teeth, giving you a +5 bonus to any subsequent grapple checks against that target

special_qualities.name: Lugubraa Learning
special_qualities.description: Before 50 years of age, a Lugubraa can have a maximum Intelligence score of 8. Around 50 years of age, a Lugubraa's Intelligence score naturally increases by 1d4+2 points.

special_qualities.name: Natural Weapons
special_qualities.description: When you make an unarmed attack, you may choose to use your barbed tentacles (1d6 damage) or teeth (1d4 damage)

species_list.name: Lurmen
species_list.description_general: Lurmen, also known as Mygeetans, are small, lemur-like pacifistic humanoids from Mygeeto. They are characterized by their fur, large eyes, and ability to curl into a ball for rapid rolling movement. Lurmen society emphasizes peace and non-violence, and they are skilled healers and menders. They are generally light and agile. [Web Source: Wookieepedia]

special_qualities.name: Mender
special_qualities.description: If you are trained in Treat Injury, you reduce the DC for all applications of that skill by your WIS bonus

special_qualities.name: Primitive
special_qualities.description: You do not gain Weapon Proficiency (pistols, rifles, or heavy weapons) as starting feats at first level, even if your class normally grants them

effects.notes: Does not gain these as starting feats even if class normally grants them.

special_qualities.name: Roller
special_qualities.description: A Lurmen can curl into a ball and quickly roll along the ground. As a swift action, a Lurmen can increase his or her base speed by 4. In this form, the Lurmen can take only move, withdraw, catch a second wind, drop an item, recover, and run actions. The Lurmen can also spend a swift action to emerge from rolling form, losing the +4 speed bonus and regaining access to all actions he or she can normally take.

special_qualities.name: Skills (Climb)
special_qualities.description: You may choose to take 10 on Climb checks even when distracted or threatened

species_list.name: Mantellian Savrip
species_list.description_general: Mantellian Savrips are large, powerfully built reptilian predators native to the planet Ord Mantell. They possess formidable natural weaponry, including claws and poisonous attacks, and are covered in tough, natural armor. Savrips are known for their ferocity and can enter a rage-like state in combat. Despite their intimidating appearance, some possess a primitive level of sentience. [Web Source: Wookieepedia]

special_qualities.name: Natural Armor
special_qualities.description: You gain a +2 natural armor bonus to your Reflex Defense.

special_qualities.name: Natural Weapons (Claws)
special_qualities.description: When you make an unarmed attack, you may choose to use your claws, dealing 1d6 slashing damage.

special_qualities.name: Poison (Claws)
special_qualities.description: If the claws of a Savrip deal damage to a living target, the target is also poisoned. If the poison succeeds on an attack roll (1d20 + the Savrip's character level) against the target's Fortitude Defense, the target moves -1 step along the condition track. A target moved to the end of the condition track by the poison is immobilized, but not unconscious.

special_qualities.name: Primitive
special_qualities.description: You do not gain Weapon Proficiency (pistols, rifles, or heavy weapons) as starting feats at first level, even if your class normally grants them.

effects.notes: Does not gain these as starting feats even if class normally grants them.

special_qualities.name: Rage
special_qualities.description: Once/day you can fly into a rage as a swift action, temporarily gaining +2 rage bonus to melee attack rolls and damage rolls, but unable to use skills requiring concentration and patience; lasts 5 + Constitution rounds, and moves character -1 persistent step along the condition track until 10 minutes of relaxed recuperation have passed.

species_list.name: Massassi
species_list.description_general: The Massassi were an ancient warrior offshoot of the Sith species, known for their brute strength, ferocity in combat, and unwavering loyalty to their Sith masters. They were often used as shock troops and temple guardians. Massassi typically possessed red skin, sharp claws, and a primitive but highly effective warrior culture, deeply immersed in the dark side of the Force. [Web Source: Wookieepedia, based on Sith Pureblood and Massassi lore.]

special_qualities.name: Conditional Bonus Feat
special_qualities.description: You gain Skill Focus (Survival) as a bonus feat if you are trained in the Survival skill.

special_qualities.name: Duty Bound
special_qualities.description: Once/encounter when you receive a morale bonus of any kind from any source, you gain bonus hit points equal to 4 x your level until the end of the encounter.

special_qualities.name: Primitive
special_qualities.description: You do not gain Weapon Proficiency (pistols, rifles, or heavy weapons) as starting feats at first level, even if your class normally grants them.

effects.notes: Does not gain these as starting feats even if class normally grants them.

special_qualities.name: Warrior's Awareness
special_qualities.description: Once/encounter as a reaction you can gain the benefit of the Uncanny Dodge 1 and Uncanny Dodge 2 talents until the beginning of your next turn.

special_qualities.name: Weapon Familiarity (Lanvarok)
special_qualities.description: You treat the lanvarok as a simple weapon instead of an exotic weapon.

species_list.name: Miraluka
species_list.description_general: The Miraluka are a Force-sensitive near-Human species whose eyes have atrophied, causing them to 'see' their surroundings through the Force (Force Sight) instead of conventional vision. They typically wear veils or masks over their vestigial eye sockets. Miraluka are known for their deep connection to the Force, often becoming Jedi, and their culture values insight and perception beyond the physical. [Web Source: Wookieepedia]

special_qualities.name: Conditional Bonus Feat
special_qualities.description: You gain Force Training as a bonus feat if you are trained in the Use the Force skill.

special_qualities.name: Force Sight
special_qualities.description: Although blind, Miraluka can "see" by using the Force. They act normally without taking any penalties for blindness when in the presence of living creatures or life of any kind. This trait enables them to make Perception checks, and read and write as a sighted person. They can ignore the effect of darkness as if they had darkvision. Miraluka cannot, however, detect creatures that are "invisible" to the Force such as the Yuuzhan Vong and the ysalamiri. These creatures have total concealment from Miraluka, as do creatures in areas that dampen or suppress the Force. Additionally, the Miraluka ignores all penalties to Perception checks from cover and concealment (but not total cover or total concealment). Miraluka do not increase the DC of Use the Force checks made to Sense Surroundings against targets with total cover.

effects.details: Effectively blind but 'sees' through the Force. No penalties for blindness in presence of life. Can make Perception checks, read/write. Ignores darkness like darkvision. Ignores cover/concealment for Perception (not total). Cannot detect beings invisible to the Force (total concealment). Does not increase DC of Use the Force (Sense Surroundings) against targets with total cover.

species_list.name: Mon Calamari
species_list.description_general: Amphibious land-dwellers sharing Mon Calamari with Quarren. Soft-spoken but vigorously defend causes. Suffered under Empire, early supporters of Rebel Alliance. Renowned for analytical/organizational abilities and ship design. View creations as art. Creative, quiet, inquisitive dreamers who cherish peace but fight for beliefs. Average 1.8m tall, high-domed heads, large eyes, smooth mottled skin. Homeworld: Mon Calamari. Idealistic and daring adventurers. [Source: CRB p.29-30]

special_qualities.name: Breathe Underwater
special_qualities.description: As amphibious creatures, Mon Calamari can't drown in water. [CRB p.30]

effects.details: Cannot drown in water.

special_qualities.name: Expert Swimmer
special_qualities.description: A Mon Calamari may choose to reroll any Swim check, but the result of the reroll must be accepted even if it is worse. In addition, a Mon Calamari may choose to take 10 on Swim checks even when distracted or threatened. [CRB p.30]

special_qualities.name: Low-Light Vision
special_qualities.description: Mon Calamari ignore concealment (but not total concealment) from darkness. [CRB p.30]

effects.details: Ignores concealment (but not total concealment) from darkness.

special_qualities.name: Conditional Bonus Feat
special_qualities.description: Keenly perceptive, a Mon Calamari with Perception as a trained skill gains Skill Focus (Perception) as a bonus feat. [CRB p.30]

species_list.name: Mrlssi
species_list.description_general: Mrlssi are a diminutive, avian-like species from the planet Mrlsst. They are known for their academic pursuits and keen intellect, often excelling as scholars, scientists, and technicians. Mrlssi society values knowledge and intellectual achievement highly. [Web Source: Based on common descriptions of scholarly Star Wars species.]

special_qualities.name: Conditional Bonus Feat
special_qualities.description: You gain Skill Focus (Persuasion) as a bonus feat if you are trained in the Persuasion skill.

special_qualities.name: Scholarly Inclination
special_qualities.description: You gain any one trained Knowledge skill as a bonus skill.

special_qualities.name: Skills (Mechanics Class Skill)
special_qualities.description: You have Mechanics as a class skill.

species_list.name: Nagai
species_list.description_general: The Nagai are a slender, pale-skinned near-Human species from the planet Nagi, located in the Unknown Regions. They are known for their distinctive angular features, dark hair, and a culture that values discipline, aesthetics, and martial prowess. Nagai society has a history of conflict with the Tof. They are often seen as graceful and somewhat stoic. [Web Source: Wookieepedia]

special_qualities.name: Lightning Reflexes
special_qualities.description: You gain a +2 species bonus to your Reflex Defense.

special_qualities.name: Soothing Voice
special_qualities.description: You may choose to reroll any Persuasion check, but you must accept the result of the reroll (must take re-roll).

special_qualities.name: Weapon Familiarity (Tehk'la Blades)
special_qualities.description: You treat tehk'la blades as simple weapons instead of exotic weapons.

species_list.name: Nautolan
species_list.description_general: Nautolans are an amphibious humanoid species from the planet Glee Anselm, characterized by their thick head-tresses (tentacles) that contain olfactory and chemoreceptive organs, allowing them to sense pheromones and emotional states. They possess green, blue, or brown skin and large, dark eyes. Nautolans are strong swimmers and can breathe underwater, with a generally peaceful but determined nature. [Web Source: Wookieepedia]

special_qualities.name: Breathe Underwater
special_qualities.description: You cannot drown in water.

effects.details: Cannot drown in water.

special_qualities.name: Expert Swimmer
special_qualities.description: You can choose to reroll any Swim check, but you must accept the second result, and you can take 10 on Swim checks even when distracted or threatened.

special_qualities.name: Low-Light Vision
special_qualities.description: You ignore concealment (but not total concealment) from darkness.

effects.details: Ignores concealment (but not total concealment) from darkness.

special_qualities.name: Natural Damage Reduction
special_qualities.description: You gain DR 2.

special_qualities.name: Phenomenal Sensor
special_qualities.description: You can reroll any Perception check made to sense deception or influence, but you must accept the result of the reroll; when underwater, you may take the better of the two rolls instead (must take re-roll).

species_list.name: Nazren
species_list.description_general: The Nazren are a robust humanoid species known for their physical resilience and stubborn nature. Hailing from a harsh environment, they have adapted to be exceptionally tough. Their societal structures often emphasize endurance and strength. [Web Source: Based on common tropes for resilient species in Star Wars lore and provided stats.]

special_qualities.name: Nazren Resilience
special_qualities.description: Once/encounter, when you would be moved down the condition track by taking damage equal to or exceeding your damage threshold, you may reduce the number of steps moved down the condition track by 1 (minimum 0 steps).

species_list.name: Near-Human Ability adjustment
species_list.description_general: This represents a common variant rule for creating Near-Human species, allowing a +2 bonus to one ability score and a -2 penalty to a different ability score, providing a baseline for further trait customization. This is considered a primary trait applied when defining a specific Near-Human variant. [Web Source: Interpretation based on typical RPG Near-Human variant rules.]

special_qualities.name: Near-Human Baseline
special_qualities.description: Represents the standard +2/-2 ability score adjustment for many Near-Human variants. Other specific traits are typically applied in addition to this core adjustment.

effects.summary: Defines the +2 to one ability score and -2 to another different ability score for this Near-Human template.

species_list.name: Near-Human Additional arms
species_list.description_general: This Near-Human variant trait grants additional arms. This implies the standard Near-Human ability adjustment of +2 to one ability and -2 to another is also applied unless specified otherwise for this variant type. [Web Source: Interpretation based on typical RPG variant rules.]

special_qualities.name: Additional Arms
special_qualities.description: This Near-Human variant possesses more than the standard two arms, potentially impacting item usage or grappling.

effects.details: Possesses extra arms. Specific mechanics (number of arms, benefits such as bonuses to grapple or ability to hold more items) would need to be defined per Core Rulebook or GM discretion, often granting benefits similar to Codru-Ji or other multi-limbed species.

species_list.name: Near-Human Altiri
species_list.description_general: The Altiri are a visually striking Near-Human species known for their captivating appearance, which gives them a natural edge in social interactions, particularly persuasion, with other humanoids. They also possess an innate curiosity and adaptability, reflected in an additional trained skill. [Web Source: Based on provided traits from UR p.163 and general Star Wars species lore patterns.]

special_qualities.name: Bonus Trained Skill
special_qualities.description: You choose one additional trained skill

special_qualities.name: Visually Striking
special_qualities.description: Your CHA bonus is doubled when using the Persuasion skill on humans, near-humans or similar humanoids (such as Twi'leks)

species_list.name: Near-Human Anarrian
species_list.description_general: Anarrians are a Near-Human species noted for their physical strength and adaptability, granting them a bonus feat. They possess a unique ability for a 'strength surge,' allowing them to briefly enhance their physical might for a crucial ability check or to deal extra damage in melee combat. [Web Source: Based on provided traits from UR p.163 and general Star Wars species lore patterns.]

special_qualities.name: Bonus Feat
special_qualities.description: You gain one bonus feat

special_qualities.name: Strength Surge
special_qualities.description: Once per encounter, can reroll one Strength-based ability or skill check, doubling the character's Strength modifier (minimum +1), or can add 2 to a single damage roll on a successful melee attack, when Strength normally adds to the roll. This does not apply when Weapon Finesse is used.

options.effect_description: Reroll one STR-based ability or skill check, doubling STR modifier (min +1 for this reroll).
Add +2 to a single damage roll on a successful melee attack where STR normally adds to damage (not applicable if Weapon Finesse used).

species_list.name: Near-Human Biotech augmentation
species_list.description_general: This Near-Human variant trait indicates inherent or culturally common biotechnological augmentations, enhancing natural abilities or providing new ones through integrated organic technology. Specific effects depend on the nature of the augmentation. Assumes standard Near-Human ability adjustment (+2 to one, -2 to another) is applied separately if this variant is chosen. [Web Source: Interpretation based on typical RPG variant rules for biotech.]

special_qualities.name: Biotech Augmentation
special_qualities.description: Possesses biotechnological enhancements. Specific mechanics depend on the augmentation defined by GM or Core Rulebook.

effects.details: Specific effects of augmentation to be defined (e.g., ability bonus, special sense, natural weapon).

species_list.name: Near-Human Breathe underwater
species_list.description_general: This Near-Human variant trait grants the ability to breathe underwater indefinitely, typically due to gills or specialized lungs, allowing for extended aquatic operations without external apparatus. Assumes standard Near-Human ability adjustment (+2 to one, -2 to another) is applied separately if this variant is chosen. [Web Source: Interpretation based on typical RPG variant rules for aquatic adaptation.]

special_qualities.name: Breathe Underwater

effects.details: Cannot drown in water.

species_list.name: Near-Human Climate adaptation
species_list.description_general: This Near-Human variant trait signifies adaptation to a specific extreme climate (e.g., arctic cold, desert heat, high humidity), granting resistance or bonuses to endure its effects. Assumes standard Near-Human ability adjustment (+2 to one, -2 to another) is applied separately if this variant is chosen. [Web Source: Interpretation based on typical RPG variant rules for environmental adaptation.]

special_qualities.name: Climate Adaptation
special_qualities.description: Adapted to a specific extreme climate, granting benefits such as bonuses to Survival checks or Fortitude defense against environmental effects.

species_list.name: Near-Human Conductive
species_list.description_general: This Near-Human variant trait implies a biological or cybernetic property that makes the individual unusually conductive to certain forms of energy, potentially interacting with electrical attacks or energy fields in unique ways. Assumes standard Near-Human ability adjustment (+2 to one, -2 to another) is applied separately if this variant is chosen. [Web Source: Interpretation based on typical RPG variant rules for energy interaction.]

species_list.name: Near-Human Cultural cybernetics
species_list.description_general: This Near-Human variant trait suggests that cybernetic augmentation is a common and integrated part of their culture, leading to widespread use of implants for various purposes from birth or an early age. Assumes standard Near-Human ability adjustment (+2 to one, -2 to another) is applied separately if this variant is chosen. species_list.name: Near-Human Darkvision
species_list.description_general: This Near-Human variant trait grants Darkvision, allowing the individual to see in areas of total darkness as if they were dimly lit. Assumes standard Near-Human ability adjustment (+2 to one, -2 to another) is applied separately if this variant is chosen. [Web Source: Standard RPG definition of Darkvision.]

special_qualities.name: Darkvision

species_list.name: Near-Human Expert swimmer

species_list.description_general: This Near-Human variant trait grants natural weaponry such as claws or fangs, allowing for more effective unarmed attacks. species_list.description_general: This Near-Human variant trait indicates a natural aptitude for acrobatics, balance, and bodily control. special_qualities.description: Possesses enhanced acrobatic capabilities.

effects.details: Specific benefits (e.g., reroll Acrobatics checks, bonus to Acrobatics skill) to be defined by GM or Core Rulebook.

species_list.name: Near-Human O'reenians
species_list.description_general: O'reenians are a Near-Human species known for their heightened awareness and remarkable endurance. These traits allow them to better perceive their surroundings and withstand physically taxing situations. They are presumed to follow standard Near-Human ability adjustment rules unless specified otherwise. [Web Source: Based on provided traits from UR p.179.]

species_list.name: Neimodian
species_list.description_general: Neimoidians are reptilian humanoids (1.6-2m tall, slight build) with mottled green-gray skin, large red eyes, and flat, noseless faces. They are motivated by control and acquisition of wealth/power. Their culture values bureaucracy and commerce. Known for their association with the Trade Federation. Raised as grubs before maturing. [Source: CRB p.286 (Other Species section)]

special_qualities.name: Conditional Bonus Feat
special_qualities.description: Neimoidians with Deception as a trained skill gain Skill Focus (Deception) as a bonus feat. [CRB p.286]

special_qualities.name: Skills (Reroll Deception)

species_list.name: Nelvaanian
species_list.description_general: Nelvaanians, also known as Nelvaans, are a primitive canine-like humanoid species from the planet Nelvaan. They are characterized by their blue fur, wolfish snouts, and a tribal warrior culture deeply connected to nature and spiritual traditions. They possess low-light vision and keen senses, making them excellent hunters and trackers. Their society was tragically affected by Separatist experiments during the Clone Wars. [Web Source: Wookieepedia]

effects.notes: Does not gain these as starting feats even if class normally grants them.

special_qualities.name: Scent
special_qualities.description: At close range (within 10 squares), you ignore concealment and cover for purposes of Perception checks, and you take no penalty from poor visibility when tracking.

special_qualities.name: Shadow Swiftness
special_qualities.description: If you start your turn with concealment from a target or with the targets unaware of you, you do not provoke attacks of opportunity when moving through the target's threatened space until the end of your turn.

species_list.name: Nikto
species_list.description_general: Niktos are a reptilian humanoid species from Kintan, known for their rugged appearance, natural armor, and cultural ties to the Hutts, often serving them as enforcers. There are several subspecies (Red, Green, Mountain, Pale, Southern Niktos), each with distinct physical traits adapted to different environments on their harsh homeworld. They are generally seen as tough and resilient. [Web Source: Wookieepedia]

special_qualities.name: Great Fortitude
special_qualities.description: You gain a +2 species bonus to your Fortitude Defense.

special_qualities.name: Natural Armor
special_qualities.description: You gain a +2 natural armor bonus to your Reflex Defense.

special_qualities.name: Survival Instinct
special_qualities.description: You may choose to reroll any Survival check, but you must accept the result of the reroll (must take re-roll).

species_list.name: Noghri
species_list.description_general: The Noghri are a diminutive but incredibly skilled and deadly humanoid species from the planet Honoghr. They are renowned as elite assassins and trackers, possessing exceptional senses (particularly smell), natural weaponry (claws and teeth), and a fierce loyalty to those they serve, most notably the Empire and later the New Republic through Leia Organa Solo. Their homeworld was ecologically devastated, leading to a complex relationship with offworlders. [Web Source: Wookieepedia]

special_qualities.name: Bonus Feat (Martial Arts I)
special_qualities.description: Martial Arts 1.

special_qualities.name: Conditional Bonus Feat
special_qualities.description: You gain Running Attack as a bonus feat if your DEX is 13 or better.

special_qualities.name: Primitive
special_qualities.description: You do not gain Weapon Proficiency (pistols, rifles, or heavy weapons) as starting feats at first level, even if your class normally grants them.

effects.notes: Does not gain these as starting feats even if class normally grants them.

special_qualities.name: Scent
special_qualities.description: At close range (within 10 squares), you ignore concealment and cover for purposes of Perception checks, and you take no penalty from poor visibility when tracking.

special_qualities.name: Skills (Reroll Initiative)
special_qualities.description: You can reroll any Initiative check, but you must accept the result of the reroll (must take re-roll).

species_list.description_general: The Noghri are a diminutive but incredibly skilled and deadly humanoid species from the planet Honoghr. They are renowned as elite assassins and trackers, possessing exceptional senses (particularly smell), natural weaponry (claws and teeth), and a fierce loyalty to those they serve, most notably the Empire and later the New Republic through Leia Organa Solo. Their homeworld was ecologically devastated, leading to a complex relationship with offworlders. [Web Source: Wookieepedia - Note: General description for Noghri; specific traits from F source should be prioritized if different.]

special_qualities.name: Bonus Feat (Martial Arts I)
special_qualities.description: Martial Arts 1.

special_qualities.name: Conditional Bonus Feat
special_qualities.description: You gain Running Attack as a bonus feat if your DEX is 13 or better.
