special_qualities.description: You do not gain Weapon Proficiency (pistols, rifles, or heavy weapons) as starting feats at first level, even if your class normally grants them.

effects.notes: Does not gain these as starting feats even if class normally grants them.

special_qualities.name: Scent
special_qualities.description: At close range (within 10 squares), you ignore concealment and cover for purposes of Perception checks, and you take no penalty from poor visibility when tracking.

special_qualities.name: Skills (Reroll Initiative)
special_qualities.description: You can reroll any Initiative check, but you must accept the result of the reroll (must take re-roll).

species_list.name: Nosaurian
species_list.description_general: Nosaurians are reptilian humanoids native to New Plympto, characterized by their horned heads, tough hides, and strong climbing abilities. They are known for their fierce independence and warrior traditions. Nosaurian culture is deeply tied to their clan structures and their history of resisting off-world domination. [Web Source: Wookieepedia]

special_qualities.name: Climber's Heritage
special_qualities.description: You have Climb as a class skill

special_qualities.name: Natural Weapons (Horns)
special_qualities.description: When you make an unarmed attack, you may choose to use your horns, dealing 1d6 piercing damage

special_qualities.name: Survival Instinct
special_qualities.description: You may choose to reroll any Survival check, but you must accept the result of the reroll (must take re-roll)

species_list.name: Nyriaanan
species_list.description_general: Nyriaanans are a humanoid species known for their innate survival skills and keen senses, particularly low-light vision. They are generally adaptable and resourceful, often gaining bonus feats or skills that reflect their ability to thrive in diverse environments. Their specific homeworld and broader cultural details are less commonly documented. [Web Source: Based on traits provided in GI p.144 and general Star Wars species archetypes.]

special_qualities.name: Bonus Class Skill (Survival)
special_qualities.description: Survival is always considered a class skill for Nyriaanans.

special_qualities.name: Bonus Feat
special_qualities.description: You gain one bonus feat

special_qualities.name: Low-Light Vision
special_qualities.description: You ignore concealment (but not total concealment) from darkness

effects.details: Ignores concealment (but not total concealment) from darkness.

species_list.name: Pa'lowick
species_list.description_general: Pa'lowick are sentient, amphibious beings from the swampy world of Lowick. They have large, froglike heads with wide mouths, bulbous eyes, and thin bodies supported by spindly legs. Pa'lowick are known for their distinctive vocalizations and often possess a natural affinity for their swampy environments, being expert swimmers and able to hold their breath for extended periods. They are generally considered a primitive species. [Web Source: Wookieepedia]

special_qualities.name: Expert Swimmer
special_qualities.description: You can choose to reroll any Swim check, but you must accept the second result, and you can take 10 on Swim checks even when distracted or threatened

special_qualities.name: Hold Breath
special_qualities.description: You can hold your breath for a number of rounds equal to 25 x your CON score before having to make Endurance checks to hold your breath

effects.notes: Before Endurance checks are required.

special_qualities.name: Primitive
special_qualities.description: You do not gain Weapon Proficiency (pistols, rifles, or heavy weapons) as starting feats at first level, even if your class normally grants them

effects.notes: Does not gain these as starting feats even if class normally grants them.

species_list.name: Pau'an
species_list.description_general: Pau'ans, also known as Utapauns or Ancients, are gaunt, long-limbed humanoids native to the sinkhole world of Utapau. They have pale, deeply grooved skin, sharp teeth, and typically possess a calm, sophisticated demeanor. Pau'an society is ancient and values tradition, with a hierarchical structure. They are known for their longevity and often serve in administrative or leadership roles. [Web Source: Wookieepedia]

special_qualities.name: Authority
special_qualities.description: As a species accustomed to being in authority, Pauâ€™ans add +1 to any insight or morale bonuses they grant to themselves or other characters.

special_qualities.name: Conditional Bonus Feat
special_qualities.description: You gain Skill Focus (Persuasion) as a bonus feat if you are trained in the Persuasion skill

special_qualities.name: Low-Light Vision
special_qualities.description: You ignore concealment (but not total concealment) from darkness

effects.details: Ignores concealment (but not total concealment) from darkness.

species_list.name: Phindian
species_list.description_general: Phindians are a humanoid species known for their technical aptitude and logical minds. They often excel in fields requiring engineering, mechanics, or detailed analysis. Their culture tends to value knowledge and problem-solving. [Web Source: Based on common Star Wars species archetypes valuing technology and intellect.]

special_qualities.name: Bonus Feat (Skill Training - Knowledge Technology)
special_qualities.description: You gain Skill Training (Knowledge (technology)) as a bonus feat

special_qualities.name: Conditional Bonus Feat
special_qualities.description: You gain Skill Focus (Mechanics) as a bonus feat if you are trained in the Mechanics skill

species_list.name: Polis Massan
species_list.description_general: Polis Massans are slender, mute humanoids from the asteroid colony of Polis Massa. They are known for their exceptional medical skills, particularly in obstetrics and trauma care, as well as their archaeological expertise. Polis Massans communicate through sign language, technological aids, and a limited form of telepathy. They are generally peaceful and dedicated to preserving life and knowledge. [Web Source: Wookieepedia]

special_qualities.name: Conditional Bonus Feat
special_qualities.description: You gain Skill Focus (Treat Injury) as a bonus feat if you are trained in the Treat Injury skill

special_qualities.name: Darkvision
special_qualities.description: You ignore concealment (including total concealment) from darkness

effects.details: Ignores concealment (including total concealment) from darkness.

special_qualities.name: Limited Telepathy
special_qualities.description: In conjunction with their sign language and technological methods of communication, Polis Massans are able to employ a weak form telepathy that allows them to convey simple feelings and thoughts to any willing recipient within ten squares. They can use the Telepathy aspect of the Use the Force skill untrained (even if not Force-sensitive). If the target of the telepathy is within 10 squares, no skill check is requires to initiate the telepathic contact.

effects.details: Convey simple feelings/thoughts to willing recipient. Can use Use the Force (Telepathy) untrained. No check needed for willing target within 10 squares.

special_qualities.name: Mute
special_qualities.description: Polis Massans have no vocal cords, and must rely on a combination of sign language, computers, and telepathy in order to communicate with others. When they learn new languages, they can understand but not speak them.

species_list.name: Quarren
species_list.description_general: From Mon Calamari, dwelling in deep ocean cities. More isolationist than Mon Calamari. Offworld, often involved in shadowy occupations (pirates, smugglers, spies). Blame Empire and Rebels for homeworld's devastation. Practical, conservative, hate change, distrust optimism. Average 1.8m tall, leathery skin, squid-like heads with four tentacles. Homeworld: Mon Calamari. Adventurers often seek to escape dependency, operating as scoundrels or nobles in criminal organizations. [Source: CRB p.30]

special_qualities.name: Breathe Underwater
special_qualities.description: As amphibious creatures, Quarren can't drown in water. [CRB p.30]

effects.details: Cannot drown in water.

special_qualities.name: Expert Swimmer
special_qualities.description: A Quarren may choose to reroll any Swim check, but the result of the reroll must be accepted even if it is worse. In addition, a Quarren may choose to take 10 on Swim checks even when distracted or threatened. [CRB p.30]

special_qualities.name: Low-Light Vision
special_qualities.description: Quarren ignore concealment (but not total concealment) from darkness. [CRB p.30]

effects.details: Ignores concealment (but not total concealment) from darkness.

special_qualities.name: Conditional Bonus Feat
special_qualities.description: Adept traders and negotiators, Quarren with Persuasion as a trained skill gains Skill Focus (Persuasion) as a bonus feat. [CRB p.30]

species_list.name: Rakata
species_list.description_general: The Rakata, also known as the Builders, are an ancient amphibious humanoid species with a history of galactic conquest powered by Force-based technology. They possess distinctive finned heads and three-fingered hands. After their Infinite Empire collapsed due to a plague that severed their Force connection, their descendants became more primitive, though some retained knowledge of their advanced past. [Web Source: Wookieepedia]

special_qualities.name: Ancient Knowledge
special_qualities.description: Rakata retain many of the qualities that led their ancestors to create great technological works in the distant past. Rakata reduce the penalty for not being proficient in a weapon from -5 to -2 and reduce the armor check penalty for armor they are not proficient in by one step (-5 for heavy armor, -2 for medium armor, and no penalty for light armor). All other penalties for not being proficient still apply. Additionally, once per encounter the Rakata can use a trained-only application of the Mechanics, Pilot, Treat injury or Use Computer skill even if untrained in that skill.

special_qualities.name: Conditional Bonus Feat
special_qualities.description: Rakata with Weapon Proficiency (simple weapons) or proficient in an Exotic melee weapon gain the Weapon Focus feat (for simple weapons or a chosen Exotic melee weapon) as a bonus feat.

special_qualities.name: Force Blind
special_qualities.description: Have lost the connection to the Force. Cannot take the Force Sensitivity feat. Can still increase Dark Side Score and are still affected by Force powers, talents, and the Use the Force skill as normal.

effects.notes: Still affected by Force powers/talents and can gain Dark Side Points.

special_qualities.name: Primitive
special_qualities.description: You do not gain Weapon Proficiency (pistols, rifles, or heavy weapons) as starting feats at first level, even if your class normally grants them

effects.notes: Does not gain these as starting feats even if class normally grants them.

special_qualities.name: Rage
special_qualities.description: Once/day you can fly into a rage as a swift action, temporarily gaining +2 rage bonus to melee attack rolls and damage rolls, but unable to use skills requiring concentration and patience; lasts 5 + Constitution rounds, and moves character -1 persistent step along the condition track until 10 minutes of relaxed recuperation have passed

species_list.name: Replica Droid
species_list.description_general: Replica Droids are advanced droids designed to perfectly imitate organic beings, often for infiltration, espionage, or as decoys. They possess sophisticated programming and physical construction to mimic appearance and behavior. Unlike standard droids, they often have modified behavioral inhibitors and may not require standard maintenance routines. [Web Source: Based on general Star Wars lore about advanced infiltration droids.]

special_qualities.name: Bonus Equipment (Droid Systems)
special_qualities.description: Replica droids can be constructed with two of the following droid systems installed: integrated comlink, darkvision, diagnostics package, improved sensor package, internal storage (subject to size limitations), translator unit (DC 15).

special_qualities.name: Conditional Bonus Feat
special_qualities.description: You gain Skill Focus (Deception) as a bonus skill if you are trained in the Deception skill

special_qualities.name: Droid Traits (Modified)
special_qualities.description: You act as a fourth-degree droid and have all droid immunities and typical droid traits, but you ignore the maintenance requirement

effects.notes: Possesses standard droid immunities and traits.

special_qualities.name: Variable Size
special_qualities.description: Since replica droids are designed to imitate organic beings, their size depends on the species that they copy. Medium droids have no special bonuses or penalties due to their size. Those of Small size gain a +1 size bonus to their Reflex Defense and a +5 size bonus to Stealth checks but have lifting and carrying limits of three-quarters those of Medium characters.

species_list.name: Rodian
species_list.description_general: From Rodia (Tyrius system), a humid jungle world. Evolved as brutal hunters. Culture centers on 'the hunt,' glorifying violence. Bounty hunting is most honorable profession. Tend to be violent, tenacious, and dedicated. Humanoid, multifaceted eyes, tapered snout, deep green skin. Average 1.6m tall. Homeworld: Rodia. Adventurers leave to improve skills, often as bounty hunters/mercenaries. [Source: CRB p.30-31]

special_qualities.name: Heightened Awareness
special_qualities.description: A Rodian may choose to reroll any Perception check, but the result of the reroll must be accepted even if it is worse. [CRB p.31]

special_qualities.name: Low-Light Vision
special_qualities.description: Rodians ignore concealment (but not total concealment) from darkness. [CRB p.31]

effects.details: Ignores concealment (but not total concealment) from darkness.

special_qualities.name: Conditional Bonus Feat
special_qualities.description: Rodians are taught how to track and survive in the wilderness of Rodia from a very young age. A Rodian with Survival as a trained skill gains Skill Focus (Survival) as a bonus feat. [CRB p.31]

species_list.name: Ryn
species_list.description_general: The Ryn are a nomadic humanoid species known for their musical beaks, prehensile tails, and a strong cultural emphasis on storytelling, music, and dance. They are often perceived as charismatic wanderers and entertainers, with a complex social structure built around family groups and traveling troupes. Ryn possess a natural talent for making connections and gathering information. [Web Source: Wookieepedia]

special_qualities.name: Connections
special_qualities.description: Whenever a Ryn character makes a Gather Information check to learn secret information, he can forgo the credit cost. If this check fails, the Ryn can try again, but must spend the credits as normal.

special_qualities.name: Musical Beak
special_qualities.description: Ryn can move air through their beaks to create pleasant tunes and notes. When using its musical beak to imitate sounds or noises to convey deceptive information, a Ryn can reroll Deception checks and take the better resuIt. A Ryn can also throw his voice or project sounds from his musical beak out to a range of 10 squares. As a swift action, a Ryn can use ventriloquism to create a diversion to hide (see the Deception skill description on page 66 of the Saga Edition core rulebook).

effects.effect_description: Can throw voice or project sounds from musical beak.
Use ventriloquism to create a diversion to hide (Deception skill).

special_qualities.name: Prehensile Tail
special_qualities.description: Ryn have long tails nearly as strong and flexible as their hands. A Ryn can effectively hold (but not wield) a Small or smaller item with its tail. When holding a Medium or larger item with its tail, the Ryn is encumbered and considered to be carrying a heavy load.

species_list.name: Sakiyan
species_list.description_general: Sakiyans are a near-Human species from Sakiya, known for their predatory grace, keen senses (including darkvision), and a cultural emphasis on hunting and tracking. They possess an innate understanding of tactics and often excel as bounty hunters, scouts, or assassins. Sakiyan society values skill, patience, and precision. [Web Source: Wookieepedia]

special_qualities.name: Conditional Bonus Feat
special_qualities.description: You gain Skill Focus (Perception) as a bonus feat if you are trained in the Perception skill

special_qualities.name: Darkvision
special_qualities.description: You ignore concealment (including total concealment) from darkness

effects.details: Ignores concealment (including total concealment) from darkness.

special_qualities.name: Lightning Reflexes
special_qualities.description: You gain a +2 species bonus to your Reflex Defense

species_list.name: Selkath
species_list.description_general: Selkath are an amphibious humanoid species native to the ocean planet Manaan. They are known for their diplomatic neutrality, their control over the healing substance kolto (unique to Manaan), and their generally peaceful, though sometimes xenophobic, nature. Selkath possess sleek bodies, head-frills, and are adept swimmers. Their society is governed by a council and values balance and tradition. [Web Source: Wookieepedia]

special_qualities.name: Able Healer
special_qualities.description: Whenever a Selkath restores hit points to another character by any means, or aids another who is doing so, the target regains an additional 5 hit points. Additionally, once per encounter as a swift action the Selkath can grant an adjacent ally bonus hit points equal to 10 + the Selkath's level, which last until the end of the encounter

special_qualities.name: Breathe Underwater
special_qualities.description: You cannot drown in water

effects.details: Cannot drown in water.

special_qualities.name: Expert Swimmer
special_qualities.description: You can choose to reroll any Swim check, but you must accept the second result, and you can take 10 on Swim checks even when distracted or threatened

species_list.name: Shard
species_list.description_general: Shards are a sentient crystalline species that lack physical bodies of their own, instead inhabiting and animating specialized droid shells to interact with the galaxy. They are known for their unique physiology and their dependence on technology for mobility and communication. Shard culture and origins are often mysterious to outsiders. [Web Source: Wookieepedia]

special_qualities.name: Bonus Skill (Use Computer)
special_qualities.description: Shards gain Use Computer as a bonus trained Skill, regardless of their class.

effects.notes: Regardless of class.

special_qualities.name: Droid Shell Dependency
special_qualities.description: Shards must inhabit droid bodies to travel and function in the galaxy at large. In this form, they gain the following traits. -Shards must undergo maintenance as per a droid. -Shards are immune to poison, disease, radiation, noncorrosive atmospheric hazards, and vacuum. They can regain hit points only through the Repair Droid application of the Mechanics skill. They do not benefit from natural healing unless they have the Force Repair talent. -Shards are considered cybernetic creatures for the purposes of being damaged by ion weapons. -Shards can make use of droid systems and accessories, subject to some limitations. Shards can have the following droid accessories: appendages, armor, communications devices, internal storage, sensors, and translator units. Shard bodies have a cost modifier of x1.

effects.details: Must inhabit droid bodies to function.

species_list.name: Shistavanen
species_list.description_general: Shistavanens, often called 'wolfmen,' are a lupine humanoid species known for their exceptional senses, particularly smell and hearing, and their natural tracking abilities. They possess fur, pointed ears, and snouts, and are often found in roles such as scouts, bounty hunters, or wilderness guides. Shistavanen culture values skill in hunting and survival. [Web Source: Wookieepedia]

special_qualities.name: Conditional Bonus Feat
special_qualities.description: You gain Skill Focus (Perception) as a bonus feat if you are trained in the Perception skill

special_qualities.name: Low-Light Vision
special_qualities.description: You ignore concealment (but not total concealment) from darkness

effects.details: Ignores concealment (but not total concealment) from darkness.

special_qualities.name: Natural Weapons (Claws)
special_qualities.description: When you make an unarmed attack, you may choose to use your claws, dealing 1d6 slashing damage

special_qualities.name: Quick Reflexes (Reroll Initiative)
special_qualities.description: You can reroll Initiative checks, but you must accept the result of the reroll (must take re-roll)

special_qualities.name: Uncanny Tracker (Survival Class Skill)
special_qualities.description: Survival is a class skill for you

species_list.name: Skakoan
species_list.description_general: Skakoans are a humanoid species from the high-pressure methane-atmosphere world of Skako. Off-world, they must wear complex, bulky pressure suits to survive. They are known for their advanced technological skills, particularly in engineering and weapons manufacturing, and were key figures in the Techno Union. Skakoans are often perceived as cautious and pragmatic. [Web Source: Wookieepedia]

special_qualities.name: Bonus Feat (Armor Proficiency Light)
special_qualities.description: Armor Proficiency (light).

special_qualities.name: Conditional Bonus Feat
special_qualities.description: Skakoans with Mechanics as a trained skill gain Skill Focus (Mechanics).

special_qualities.name: Mechanical Savant
special_qualities.description: Once per encounter, a Skakoan can make a standard action Mechanics or Use Computer check as a swift action.

special_qualities.name: Special Equipment (Pressure Suit Requirement)
special_qualities.description: Skakoans suffer limitations outside their native atmosphere. Without a pressure suit (see below), a Skakoan takes 1d6 points of damage each round and begins to suffocate. Skakoan characters begin play with a light pressure suit at no cost.

effects.starting_equipment_note: Begins play with a light pressure suit at no cost.
effects.pressure_suit_details: Typically a light pressure suit functions as combat jumpsuit providing specific bonuses (e.g., +2 equipment bonus to Fortitude Defense per Ubese entry).

species_list.name: Sluissi
species_list.description_general: Sluissi are a serpentine humanoid species from Sluis Van, known for their exceptional mechanical aptitude and meticulous attention to detail, especially in starship engineering and repair. They possess long, flexible bodies, multiple arms, and a patient, deliberate nature. Sluissi are often considered master technicians and engineers. [Web Source: Wookieepedia]

special_qualities.name: Careful Worker
special_qualities.description: A Sluissi who takes twice the normal amount of time required to use the Mechanics skill gains a +10 circumstance bonus to the Mechanics check.

special_qualities.name: Conditional Bonus Feat
special_qualities.description: You gain Tech Specialist as a bonus feat if you are trained in the Mechanics skill

special_qualities.name: Serpentine
special_qualities.description: You are always considered to have a running start for Jump checks and gain a +5 stability bonus when making grapple checks against the Trip feat

species_list.name: Snivvian
species_list.description_general: Snivvians, also known as 'Snaggletooths,' are short, snout-nosed humanoids from Cadomai Prime. They are highly adaptable to cold environments and are known for their artistic talents, particularly in storytelling, drama, and visual arts. Snivvians are keen observers and often possess a unique perspective on the galaxy. [Web Source: Wookieepedia]

special_qualities.name: Cold Resistance
special_qualities.description: You add a +5 species bonus to Fortitude Defense to resist extreme cold

special_qualities.name: Observant
special_qualities.description: Once/encounter you can use your Perception bonus in place of your Deception or Persuasion bonus

species_list.name: Sorcerer of Rhand
species_list.description_general: The Sorcerers of Rhand are practitioners of a unique and nihilistic dark side tradition, distinct from the Sith or Nightsisters. They worship the concept of 'The Dark' as an ultimate destructive entropy and believe in a predetermined, bleak fate for the galaxy. They are known for their potent dark side abilities and often have a repulsive or unsettling appearance. [Web Source: Wookieepedia]

special_qualities.name: Bonus Feat (Force Sensitivity)
special_qualities.description: You gain Force Sensitivity as a bonus feat

special_qualities.name: Dark-Infused
special_qualities.description: You gain the Force Training feat for free, but half of the selected powers must have the (dark side) descriptor and none may have the (light side) descriptor

effects.notes: Half of selected powers must have (dark_side) descriptor; none may have (light_side) descriptor.

special_qualities.name: Repulsive Appearance
special_qualities.description: You may reroll Persuasion checks made to intimidate, keeping the better result, and you gain a +5 bonus to Will Defense to resist the Persuasion checks others make against you

special_qualities.name: Special Qualities (Unique Dark Side Traits)
special_qualities.description: Each Sorcerer gains from one to three special qualities unique to his or her relationship with the Dark. Create these qualities, or select one or more using the Creature Generator on UR page 89.

effects.creation_method_note: Create or select using Creature Generator UR p89.

species_list.name: Squib
species_list.description_general: Squibs are a diminutive, furry humanoid species from Skor II known for their obsessive collecting, haggling, and salvaging habits. They possess remarkable technical aptitude and a natural talent for diplomacy and trade, despite often being seen as pests by other species. Squib society revolves around complex systems of barter and perceived value. [Web Source: Wookieepedia]

special_qualities.name: Natural Diplomat
special_qualities.description: Persuasion is always a class skill for you and you gain a +5 species bonus to Persuasion checks made to haggle

special_qualities.name: Tech Savvy
special_qualities.description: You may choose to reroll any Knowledge (technology) checks, but you must accept the result of the reroll, and you are not limited to common knowledge when making an untrained Knowledge (technology) check (must take re-roll)

special_qualities.name: Weapon Familiarity (Squib Tensor Rifle)
special_qualities.description: You are proficient with the Squib tensor rifle if you have the Weapon Proficiency (rifles) feat

species_list.name: Ssi-Ruuk
species_list.description_general: The Ssi-ruuk (singular: Ssi-ruu) are a saurian species from the planet Lwhekk in the Unknown Regions. They are known for their advanced entechment technology, which allows them to extract the life energies of sentient beings to power their starships and droids. Ssi-ruuk society is hierarchical and xenophobic, viewing other species primarily as sources of energy. They are Force-blind and possess a keen sense of smell. [Web Source: Wookieepedia]

special_qualities.name: Conditional Bonus Feat
special_qualities.description: You gain Skill Focus (Persuasion) as a bonus feat if you are trained in the Persuasion skill

special_qualities.name: Force Blind
special_qualities.description: Have lost the connection to the Force. Cannot take the Force Sensitivity feat. Can still increase Dark Side Score and are still affected by Force powers, talents, and the Use the Force skill as normal.

effects.notes: Still affected by Force powers/talents and can gain Dark Side Points.

special_qualities.name: Keen Smell
special_qualities.description: When within 6 squares of a target in the same room or open area, you can reroll Persuasion checks against that target, keeping the best result

special_qualities.name: Natural Armor
special_qualities.description: You gain a +2 natural armor bonus to your Reflex Defense

species_list.name: Stereb
species_list.description_general: Stereb are a robust, subterranean species adapted to life underground. They are known for their physical toughness, darkvision, and skill in working with stone. Their culture often revolves around mining, craftsmanship, and resilience in harsh, lightless environments. [Web Source: Based on common tropes for subterranean species and provided traits.]

special_qualities.name: Conditional Bonus Feat (Mechanics - Stone)
special_qualities.description: Any Stereb that has Mechanics as a trained skill gains Skill Focus (Mechanics) as a bonus feat. However, this bonus applies only when the Stereb character is working with stone.

special_qualities.name: Darkvision
special_qualities.description: Stereb ignore concealment (including total concealment) from darkness. However, they cannot perceive colors in total darkness.

effects.details: Ignores concealment (including total concealment) from darkness. Cannot perceive colors in total darkness.

special_qualities.name: Primitive
special_qualities.description: Stereb do not gain Weapon Proficiency (pistols, rifles, or heavy weapons) as starting feats at 1st level, even if their class normally grants those feats

effects.notes: Does not gain these as starting feats even if class normally grants them.

special_qualities.name: Subterranean
special_qualities.description: Stereb are adapted to a subterranean life and can take 10 on Survival checks when in an underground environment, even when distracted or threatened.

special_qualities.name: Tough
special_qualities.description: Like the stone they work with, Stereb are physically hardened, gaining a +5 species bonus to their damage threshold and a +2 species bonus to their Fortitude Defense.

species_list.name: Sullustan
species_list.description_general: Evolved in Sullust's caves to survive perils of their volcanic homeworld. Prefer to dwell underground in advanced, beautiful cities. Acute senses, renowned navigators/pilots. Friendly, gregarious, enjoy interacting with unique beings, fond of practical jokes. Quickly embraced galactic civilization. SoroSuub corporation is powerful and is the government of Sullust. Humanoid with large round eyes, big ears, jowls. Average 1.5m tall. Homeworld: Sullust. Adventurers enjoy exploring, business, and pranks. [Source: CRB p.31-32]

special_qualities.name: Darkvision
special_qualities.description: Sullustans ignore concealment (including total concealment) from darkness. However, they cannot perceive colors in total darkness. [CRB p.31]

effects.details: Ignores concealment (including total concealment) from darkness. Cannot perceive colors in total darkness.

special_qualities.name: Expert Climber
special_qualities.description: Sullustans are adept at climbing in their underground homes. A Sullustan may choose to take 10 on Climb checks even when distracted or threatened. [CRB p.32]

special_qualities.name: Heightened Awareness
special_qualities.description: A Sullustan may choose to reroll any Perception check, but the result of the reroll must be accepted even if it is worse. [CRB p.32]

species_list.name: Talz
species_list.description_general: The Talz are a powerfully built, furry humanoid species from the icy planets Alzoc III and Orto Plutonia. They possess two sets of eyes (one for day, one for night vision) and a generally peaceful, if somewhat primitive, tribal culture. Talz are known for their immense strength and adaptation to cold environments, but can be provoked to great fury. [Web Source: Wookieepedia]

special_qualities.name: Conditional Bonus Feat
special_qualities.description: You gain Skill Focus (Mechanics) as a bonus feat if you are trained in the Mechanics skill.

special_qualities.name: Darkvision
special_qualities.description: You ignore concealment (including total concealment) from darkness.

effects.details: Ignores concealment (including total concealment) from darkness.

special_qualities.name: Natural Weapons (Claws)
special_qualities.description: When you make an unarmed attack, you may choose to use your claws, dealing 1d6 slashing damage.

species_list.name: Taung
species_list.description_general: The Taung were an ancient, gray-skinned humanoid warrior species originally from Coruscant, who later conquered and settled the planet Mandalore, becoming the progenitors of the Mandalorian culture. They were known for their martial prowess, resilience, strict honor codes, and distinctive armor. The Taung eventually faded from galactic prominence, but their legacy lived on through the Mandalorians. [Web Source: Wookieepedia]

special_qualities.name: Armor Training
special_qualities.description: Taung characters increase the Maximum Dexterity bonus from worn armor by 1.

special_qualities.name: Superior Defenses
special_qualities.description: You gain a +1 species bonus to all of your Defenses.

special_qualities.name: Warrior Culture
special_qualities.description: You can reroll any Knowledge (tactics) check, but you must accept the result of the reroll (must take re-roll).

species_list.name: Tchuukthai
species_list.description_general: The Tchuukthai, also known as Wharls, are large, sapient, quadrupedal beings resembling multi-ton boulders when at rest. They are native to an unknown forested world and possess a peaceful, philosophical nature, often deeply connected to the Force. Despite their bulk and stony appearance, they can be surprisingly agile. They are known for their wisdom and reclusive tendencies. [Web Source: Wookieepedia]

special_qualities.name: Quadruped
special_qualities.description: You gain +5 bonus to all defenses against effects that trip or knock you prone

species_list.name: Thakwaash
species_list.description_general: The Thakwaash are a unique species known for possessing multiple distinct personalities within a single body, each with its own skills and sometimes even differing physical capabilities when dominant. They are often large and physically imposing. Their complex psychology makes them unpredictable and versatile. [Web Source: Wookieepedia]

special_qualities.name: Multiple Personalities
special_qualities.description: Once/encounter as a free action at the start of your turn, you can negate or remove any mind-affecting effects

special_qualities.name: Natural Armor
special_qualities.description: You gain a +1 natural armor bonus to your Reflex Defense

species_list.name: Tof
species_list.description_general: The Tof were a green-skinned humanoid species from the planets Tof and Nagai, located beyond the Galactic Rim. They were known for their extreme xenophobia, militarism, and desire for conquest, engaging in a protracted war with the Nagai. Tof society was hierarchical and driven by a belief in their own superiority. [Web Source: Wookieepedia]

special_qualities.name: Bonus Feat (Choice)
special_qualities.description: You can take either Rapid Shot or Rapid Strike as a bonus feat.

special_qualities.name: Conditional Bonus Feat
special_qualities.description: You gain Mighty Swing as a bonus feat if you have Martial Arts 1 and a STR 13 or better.

special_qualities.name: Tof Fearlessness
special_qualities.description: Once/encounter you can ignore one fear-related or mind-affecting effect used against you; you have a +5 species bonus to your Will Defense when resisting attempts to intimidate you.

effects.effect_description: Ignore one fear-related or mind-affecting effect used against self.

species_list.name: Togorian
species_list.description_general: Togorians are a large, feline humanoid species from the planet Togoria. They are known for their impressive strength, hunting prowess, and a culture that values honor and martial skill. Togorians possess retractable claws, sharp teeth, and a cat-like agility despite their size. Their society is often tribal, with a deep respect for tradition and warrior codes. [Web Source: Wookieepedia]

special_qualities.name: Feline Reflexes
special_qualities.description: You gain a +1 species bonus to your Reflex Defense.

special_qualities.name: Low-Light Vision
special_qualities.description: You ignore concealment (but not total concealment) from darkness.

effects.details: Ignores concealment (but not total concealment) from darkness.

special_qualities.name: Physically Intimidating
special_qualities.description: You use your STR bonus instead of your CHA bonus for Persuasion checks made to intimidate others.

species_list.name: Togruta
species_list.description_general: Togruta are a sentient humanoid species from the planet Shili, known for their colorful skin patterns, large head-tails called lekku, and montrals (hollow horns) that grant a form of passive echolocation. They are often skilled hunters and warriors, with a strong connection to their community and natural environment. Togruta culture values unity and self-sufficiency. [Web Source: Wookieepedia]

special_qualities.name: Pack Hunter
special_qualities.description: You deal an extra 2 points of damage on melee attacks against opponents you flank.

special_qualities.name: Sneaky
special_qualities.description: You can choose to reroll any Stealth check to sneak, but you must accept the result of the reroll (must take re-roll).

special_qualities.name: Spatial Awareness
special_qualities.description: You ignore all cover and concealment when making Perception checks to notice targets within 10 squares.

species_list.name: Toydarian
species_list.description_general: Toydarians are a winged humanoid species from Toydaria, known for their resistance to Force-based mental influence and their shrewd business acumen. They possess small, pudgy bodies, snouts, and leathery wings that allow them to hover. Toydarians are often found as merchants and traders, and their unique physiology makes them immune to many forms of mind manipulation. [Web Source: Wookieepedia]

special_qualities.name: Conditional Bonus Feat
special_qualities.description: You gain Skill Focus (Deception) as a bonus feat if you are trained in the Deception skill.

special_qualities.name: Force Resistance (Mind-Affecting)
special_qualities.description: You gain a +5 species bonus to your Will Defense against any Use the Force checks with the mind-affecting descriptor.

species_list.name: Trandoshan
species_list.description_general: Reptilian Trandoshans are known for great strength and warlike natures. Many dedicate to martial training or hunting. Long-standing enmity with Wookiees. Supersensitive eyes (infrared), shed skin, regenerate limbs. Clawed hands have difficulty with fine manipulation. Violent, brutal, driven, love to compete, can show compassion. Range 1.8 to 2.1m tall. Scaly hides. Homeworld: Trandosha. Adventurers crave battle, become bodyguards, mercenaries, or explore. [Source: CRB p.32]

special_qualities.name: Darkvision
special_qualities.description: Trandoshans ignore concealment (including total concealment) from darkness. However, they cannot perceive colors in total darkness. [CRB p.32]

effects.details: Ignores concealment (including total concealment) from darkness. Cannot perceive colors in total darkness.

special_qualities.name: Limb Regeneration
special_qualities.description: A Trandoshan regrows a lost limb in 1d10 days. At the end of that time, all persistent penalties associated with the loss of the limb are removed. [CRB p.32]

special_qualities.name: Natural Armor
special_qualities.description: Trandoshans have thick scales that provide a +1 natural armor bonus to their Reflex Defense. A natural armor bonus stacks with an armor bonus. [CRB p.32, cite: 188-189]

special_qualities.name: Bonus Feat
special_qualities.description: Rugged and resilient, Trandoshans gain Toughness as a bonus feat. [CRB p.32]

species_list.name: Trianii
species_list.description_general: The Trianii are a feline humanoid species known for their agility, retractable claws, and long, prehensile tails. They hail from the Trian system and have a strong warrior tradition, organized into clans and ranger cadres. Trianii value honor, skill, and self-reliance, and are often found as explorers, scouts, or mercenaries. [Web Source: Wookieepedia]

special_qualities.name: Acrobatic Prowess
special_qualities.description: You can reroll any Acrobatics check, but you must accept the result of the reroll (must take re-roll).

special_qualities.name: Natural Weapons (Claws)
special_qualities.description: When you make an unarmed attack, you may choose to use your claws, dealing 1d6 slashing damage.

special_qualities.name: Prehensile Tail
special_qualities.description: can effectively hold (but not wield) a Small or smaller item with its tail. When holding a Medium or larger item with its tail, encumbered and considered to be carrying a heavy load.

species_list.name: Tusken Raider
species_list.description_general: Tusken Raiders, or Sand People, are a nomadic and aggressive sentient species native to the desert planet Tatooine. They are known for their distinctive full-body wrappings and masks, their use of Banthas as mounts, and their fierce territoriality. Tusken culture is tribal and deeply intertwined with survival in the harsh desert environment. [Web Source: Wookieepedia]

special_qualities.name: Skills (Reroll Stealth or Survival)
special_qualities.description: You can reroll any Stealth or Survival check, but you must accept the result of the reroll (must take re-roll).

species_list.name: Twi'lek
species_list.description_general: From Ryloth, tall, thin humanoids with tentacular head-tails (lekku). Sly, calculating, prefer to avoid trouble and stick to shadows. Entrepreneurial spirit leads to influence. Calculating, pragmatic, charismatic. Often work behind scenes. Many in business (legal/illegal), entertainment, or diplomacy. Range 1.6 to 2m tall. Varied skin tones. Homeworld: Ryloth. [Source: CRB p.32-33]

special_qualities.name: Deceptive
special_qualities.description: Naturally gifted at manipulation, a Twi'lek may choose to reroll any Deception check, but the result of the reroll must be accepted even if it is worse. [CRB p.33]

special_qualities.name: Great Fortitude
special_qualities.description: Twi'leks gain a +2 species bonus to their Fortitude Defense. Twi'leks have great health with a natural resistance to toxins and illness. [CRB p.33]

special_qualities.name: Low-Light Vision
special_qualities.description: Twi'leks ignore concealment (but not total concealment) from darkness. [CRB p.33]

effects.details: Ignores concealment (but not total concealment) from darkness.

species_list.name: Ubese
species_list.description_general: The Ubese are a humanoid species known for their nomadic warrior culture and their distinctive environmental suits and breath masks, which they wear due to their inability to tolerate most standard atmospheres. They are often secretive and xenophobic, with a reputation for being skilled mercenaries and assassins. Their homeworld, Uba IV, was environmentally devastated. [Web Source: Wookieepedia]

special_qualities.name: Aggressive
special_qualities.description: If an Ubese character hits with a charge attack, the +2 bonus on attack rolls against the target persists for the duration of the encounter.

special_qualities.name: Conditional Bonus Feat
special_qualities.description: You gain Skill Focus (Perception) as a bonus feat if you are trained in the Perception skill.

special_qualities.name: Special Equipment (Environmental Suit and Breath Mask Requirement)
special_qualities.description: Ubese cannot tolerate the atmospheres of other worlds and must rely on breath masks to survive. Without a breath mask, an Ubese begins to suffocate. When not on their homeworld, Ubese wear environmental suits to stave of the hazards found on other planets as well as to hide their appearance. An environmental suit functions as a combat jumpsuit that also grants a +2 equipment bonus to Fortitude Defense. The suit also includes a voice modulator to emulate the voice of a male or female or to mask the Ubese's gender. An Ubese environmental suit with breath mask and voice modulator costs 2,000 credits, and a year's supply of breathing filters cost 200 credits (50 credits on Ubese). Ubese characters begin with these items at no cost.

effects.details: Functions as combat jumpsuit, grants +2 equipment bonus to Fortitude Defense, includes voice modulator.
effects.starting_equipment_note: Begins play with these items at no cost.

special_qualities.name: Survival Instinct
special_qualities.description: You may choose to reroll any Survival check, but you must accept the result of the reroll (must take re-roll).

species_list.name: Ugnaught
species_list.description_general: Ugnaughts are a diminutive porcine humanoid species known for their hard work, technical skills, and stubbornness. They are often found in industrial settings, particularly in mining and manufacturing, and are skilled mechanics and engineers. Ugnaught society is communal, and they are native to Gentes, but many were enslaved and dispersed throughout the galaxy. [Web Source: Wookieepedia]
species_list.notes_for_processing: Original entry was 'Ugnaught (best guess)', retaining name as 'Ugnaught'.

species_list.name: Ugor
species_list.description_general: The Ugor are an amorphous, shape-shifting species capable of altering their physical forms. This unique physiology allows them to adapt their physical abilities by reallocating points between Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution. They are often considered mysterious and their true nature can be difficult to ascertain. [Web Source: Based on common descriptions of amorphous species and provided traits.]
species_list.notes_for_processing: Original entry was 'Ugor (best guess)', retaining name as 'Ugor'.

special_qualities.name: Amorphous Nature
special_qualities.description: As a full-round action, an Ugor can raise or lower any physical ability by a maximum of 5 points, but each point must be transferred from another similar ability (such as Str, Dex, and Con). Abilities cannot be altered more than 5 points above or below the Ugorâ€™s original scores. Bonuses and penalties (to skills, defenses, attacks, and so on) have to be adjusted accordingly.

effects.effect_description: Can reallocate points between STR, DEX, CON. Max change per ability is +/- 5 from original score. Total points remain constant among these three. Derived stats must be adjusted.

species_list.name: Umbaran
species_list.description_general: Umbarans are a pale-skinned, near-Human species from the shadowy planet Umbara, known for their ability to see in ultraviolet spectra and their often manipulative and subtle nature. They possess a hierarchical society and are skilled in espionage and political intrigue. Umbarans are typically sensitive to bright light but possess excellent darkvision and low-light vision. [Web Source: Wookieepedia]

special_qualities.name: Conditional Bonus Feat
special_qualities.description: You gain Skill Focus (Persuasion) as a bonus feat if you are trained in the Persuasion skill.

special_qualities.name: Darkvision
special_qualities.description: You ignore concealment (including total concealment) from darkness.

effects.details: Ignores concealment (including total concealment) from darkness.

special_qualities.name: Light Sensitivity
special_qualities.description: If you are exposed to bright light (such as sunlight), you're blinded for 1 round.

special_qualities.name: Low-Light Vision
special_qualities.description: You ignore concealment (but not total concealment) from darkness.

effects.details: This is in addition to Darkvision, likely meaning they still function better in dim light than complete darkness compared to species with only Darkvision, or it's redundant if Darkvision covers all low-light scenarios.

special_qualities.name: Skills (Reroll Persuasion)
special_qualities.description: You can reroll any Persuasion check, but you must accept the result of the reroll (must take re-roll).

special_qualities.name: Stealthy
special_qualities.description: You can reroll any Stealth check, but you must accept the result of the reroll (must take re-roll).

species_list.name: Umbaran
species_list.description_general: Umbarans are a pale-skinned, near-Human species from the shadowy planet Umbara, known for their ability to see in ultraviolet spectra and their often manipulative and subtle nature. They possess a hierarchical society and are skilled in espionage and political intrigue. Umbarans are typically sensitive to bright light but possess excellent darkvision and low-light vision. [Web Source: Wookieepedia - Note: General description for Umbarans; specific traits from C source should be prioritized if different.]

special_qualities.name: Conditional Bonus Feat
special_qualities.description: You gain Skill Focus (Persuasion) as a bonus feat if you are trained in the Persuasion skill.

special_qualities.name: Darkvision
special_qualities.description: You ignore concealment (including total concealment) from darkness.

effects.details: Ignores concealment (including total concealment) from darkness.

special_qualities.name: Light Sensitivity
special_qualities.description: If you are exposed to bright light (such as sunlight), you're blinded for 1 round.

special_qualities.description: You ignore concealment (but not total concealment) from darkness.

effects.details: This is in addition to Darkvision, likely meaning they still function better in dim light than complete darkness compared to species with only Darkvision, or it's redundant if Darkvision covers all low-light scenarios.

special_qualities.name: Skills (Reroll Persuasion)
special_qualities.description: You can reroll any Persuasion check, but you must accept the result of the reroll (must take re-roll).

special_qualities.name: Stealthy
special_qualities.description: You can reroll any Stealth check, but you must accept the result of the reroll (must take re-roll).

species_list.name: Utai
species_list.description_general: The Utai are a diminutive humanoid species native to the sinkhole world of Utapau, coexisting with the taller Pau'ans. They are characterized by their pale skin, large eyes, and small stature, serving primarily as laborers and animal handlers. Utai are known for their gentle nature, cooperative spirit, and innate skill with animals. [Web Source: Wookieepedia]

special_qualities.name: Animal Handler
special_qualities.description: The Utai are naturally gifted when it comes to dealing with beasts and wild creatures. An Utai can choose to reroll any Ride check, but the result of the reroll must be accepted even if it is worse. Additionally, an Utai can make Persuasion checks to change the attitude of an undomesticated creature that has an Intelligence of 2 or lower.

special_qualities.name: Cooperative
special_qualities.description: You automatically succeed when attempting to aid another on a skill check, as long as the target is adjacent to and can hear and understand you.

special_qualities.name: Low-Light Vision
special_qualities.description: You ignore concealment (but not total concealment) from darkness.

effects.details: Ignores concealment (but not total concealment) from darkness.

species_list.name: Vagaari
species_list.description_general: The Vagaari are a species of slavers and pirates from the Unknown Regions, known for their distinctive skull-like masks and their use of slave collars to control their captives. They are often depicted as cruel and expansionist, with a culture that values dominance and conquest. Vagaari possess a good working knowledge of biology, likely for a mix of medical and coercive purposes. [Web Source: Wookieepedia]

special_qualities.name: Bioknowledge
special_qualities.description: Vagaari have great working knowledge of biology throughout their sphere of influence in the Unknown Regions. They can reroll any Knowledge (life sciences) or Treat Injury check but must take the second result, even if it is worse.

special_qualities.name: Conditional Bonus Feat
special_qualities.description: You gain Skill Focus (Deception) as a bonus feat if you are trained in the Deception skill.

special_qualities.name: Frightening Visage
special_qualities.description: When using the Persuasion skill to intimidate, a Vagaari clad in traditional masks and garments can reroll a failed Persuasion check and take the better result. The Vagaari is considered trained in the Persuasion skill for this action.

species_list.name: Vahla
species_list.description_general: The Vahla are a near-Human species with a strong natural connection to the Force, though this connection is often tinged with a predisposition or stigma towards the dark side. They possess a cartilaginous skeleton, granting them unusual flexibility. Their culture and history are often intertwined with their unique Force sensitivities. [Web Source: Wookieepedia, based on general descriptions of Force-sensitive species with dark side inclinations.]

special_qualities.name: Cartilaginous Skeleton
special_qualities.description: You can reroll any Acrobatics check, but you must accept the result of the reroll (must take re-roll).

special_qualities.name: Dark Side Stigma
special_qualities.description: You must spend two Force Points to reduce your Dark Side Score by 1.

special_qualities.name: Force Sensitivity
special_qualities.description: You gain Force Sensitivity as a bonus feat.

species_list.name: Verpine
species_list.description_general: Verpine are an insectoid species from the Roche asteroid field, renowned for their exceptional technological skills and innate understanding of mechanics. They possess large, black eyes, slender bodies, and the ability to communicate with each other via radio waves. Verpine society is communal and highly focused on engineering and innovation. [Web Source: Wookieepedia]

special_qualities.name: Conditional Bonus Feat
special_qualities.description: You gain Skill Focus (Mechanics) as a bonus feat if you are trained in the Mechanics skill.

special_qualities.name: Heightened Awareness
special_qualities.description: You may choose to reroll any Perception check, but you must accept the result of the reroll (must take re-roll).

special_qualities.name: Natural Armor
special_qualities.description: You gain a +1 natural armor bonus to your Reflex Defense.

special_qualities.name: Verpine Communication
special_qualities.description: You can mentally communicate with any Verpine within a 1 kilometre radius.

species_list.name: Vultan
species_list.description_general: The Vultan are a sentient species known for their intellectual capabilities and often scholarly pursuits. They tend to value knowledge and an analytical approach to problems. Their specific physical characteristics and homeworld are less prominent in galactic records, but their mental acuity is a defining trait. [Web Source: Based on provided stats and common Star Wars species archetypes focusing on intelligence.]

special_qualities.name: Bonus Trained Skill
special_qualities.description: You choose one additional trained skill.

special_qualities.name: Conditional Bonus Feat
special_qualities.description: You gain Skill Focus (one Knowledge skill) as a bonus feat if you are trained in one or more Knowledge skills.

species_list.name: Vurk
species_list.description_general: Vurk are a saurian amphibious species from the planet Sembla, known for their nomadic lifestyle and generally placid, though sometimes stubborn, nature. They possess tall, crested heads and tough hides. Vurk society is migratory, following herd animals across their homeworld's savannas and swamps, and they are skilled swimmers. [Web Source: Wookieepedia]

special_qualities.name: Breathe Underwater
special_qualities.description: You cannot drown in water.

effects.details: Cannot drown in water.

special_qualities.name: Expert Swimmer
special_qualities.description: You can choose to reroll any Swim check, but you must accept the second result, and you can take 10 on Swim checks even when distracted or threatened.

special_qualities.name: Nomads
special_qualities.description: You can reroll any Survival check, but you must accept the result of the reroll (must take re-roll).

special_qualities.name: Placid
special_qualities.description: Once/encounter as a free action you can remove one fear effect currently affecting you.

species_list.name: Weequay
species_list.description_general: Weequays are a humanoid species from the desert planet Sriluur, known for their tough, leathery skin and their pheromonal communication abilities with other Weequays of the same clan. Their culture is deeply tied to their worship of a moon god, Quay. Weequays are often seen as stoic and resilient, frequently employed as mercenaries, pirates, or bodyguards, particularly by the Hutts. [Web Source: Wookieepedia]

special_qualities.name: Conditional Bonus Feat
special_qualities.description: You gain Skill Focus (Endurance) as a bonus feat if you are trained in the Endurance skill.

special_qualities.name: Natural Armor
special_qualities.description: You gain a +1 natural armor bonus to your Reflex Defense.

special_qualities.name: Pheromones (Communication)
special_qualities.description: Weequay communicate silently with other members of their tribe by emitting complex pheromones. This form of communication has a maximum range of 20 squares. Species with the scent ability can detect Weequay pheromones by smell, but this does not allow them to understand what the Weequay are communicating.

effects.notes: Species with scent can detect, but not understand.

species_list.name: Whiphid
species_list.description_general: Whiphids are large, powerfully built, furry carnivores from the icy planet Toola. They are known for their great strength, resilience to cold, natural claws, and keen sense of smell. Whiphid society is tribal, with a strong emphasis on hunting and survival in their harsh native environment. They are often sought after as big game hunters, mercenaries, or enforcers. [Web Source: Wookieepedia]

special_qualities.name: Insulating Fur
special_qualities.description: You gain a +5 species bonus to Fortitude Defense to resist extreme cold.

special_qualities.name: Natural Weapons (Claws)
special_qualities.description: When you make an unarmed attack, you may choose to use your claws, dealing 1d6 slashing damage.

special_qualities.name: Scent
special_qualities.description: At close range (within 10 squares), you ignore concealment and cover for purposes of Perception checks, and you take no penalty from poor visibility when tracking.

species_list.name: Wookiee
species_list.description_general: Widely recognized as one of the strongest and fiercest intelligent species. Customs revolve around honor and loyalty (honor family, life debt). Never use climbing claws in combat (dishonorable). Tend to be honorable, rash, loyal, and short-tempered. Large furry bipeds, 2 to 2.3m tall. Homeworld: Kashyyyk. Adventurers often start as wanderers/explorers or due to honor family/life debt. [Source: CRB p.33]

special_qualities.name: Extraordinary Recuperation
special_qualities.description: A Wookiee regains hit points at double the normal rate. [CRB p.33]

special_qualities.name: Rage
special_qualities.description: Once per day, a Wookiee can fly into a rage as a swift action. While raging, temporarily gains +2 rage bonus on melee attack rolls and melee damage rolls but cannot use skills requiring patience/concentration (Mechanics, Stealth, Use the Force). Lasts 5 + CON modifier rounds. At end of rage, moves -1 persistent step on condition track (removed by 10 min recuperation without strenuous activity). [CRB p.33, cite: 196-197]

special_qualities.name: Weapon Familiarity (Bowcasters)
special_qualities.description: Wookiees with the Weapon Proficiency (rifles) feat are proficient with the bowcaster. (Errata p.297: Wookiees treat bowcasters as rifles instead of exotic weapons.) [CRB p.33]

effects.notes: Errata clarifies they treat these as rifles if proficient with rifles generally.

special_qualities.name: Skills (Climb and Intimidation)
special_qualities.description: Wookiees are great climbers and may choose to take 10 on Climb checks even when distracted or threatened. Known to pull the ears off gundarks, they may choose to reroll any Persuasion check made to intimidate others, but the result of the reroll must be accepted even if it is worse. [CRB p.33]

species_list.name: Wroonian
species_list.description_general: Wroonians are a blue-skinned, near-Human species from the planet Wroona in the Inner Rim. They are known for their free-spirited nature, adaptability, and often a talent for persuasion and negotiation. Wroonian culture values independence and exploration, and they are commonly found throughout the galaxy as traders, pilots, and adventurers. [Web Source: Wookieepedia]

special_qualities.name: Free Spirit
special_qualities.description: You gain a +2 species bonus to your Will Defense.

special_qualities.name: Skills (Reroll Persuasion)
special_qualities.description: You can reroll Persuasion checks, but you must accept the result of the reroll (must take re-roll).

species_list.name: Yarkora
species_list.description_general: Yarkora are large, powerfully built humanoids with thick gray hides and snouted faces, hailing from a forgotten world. They are known for their deceptive abilities and a unique defense mechanism involving confusing motions and sounds to deter enemies. Their culture often emphasizes cunning and social manipulation. [Web Source: Wookieepedia]

special_qualities.name: Confusion
special_qualities.description: As a defense mechanism, all Yarkora can use a combination of motions and sounds to distract and deter potential enemies. Once per encounter as a standard action, a Yarkora can make a Deception check against the Will Defense of all targets within 6 squares. If the Deception check result equals or exceeds a target's Will Defense, that target does not threaten any squares until the end of the Yarkora's next turn. This is a mind-affecting effect.

special_qualities.name: Deceptive
special_qualities.description: You may choose to reroll any Deception check, but you must accept the result of the reroll (must take re-roll).

special_qualities.name: Streetwise (Gather Information Class Skill)
special_qualities.description: You have Gather Information as a class skill.

species_list.name: Yevetha
species_list.description_general: The Yevetha are a xenophobic and technologically adept humanoid species from N'zoth in the Koornacht Cluster. They possess gaunt frames, retractable dewclaws, and a rigid, hierarchical society that views other species with disdain. Yevetha are known for their biological ship technology and their history of aggressive expansionism and enslavement of other races. [Web Source: Wookieepedia]

special_qualities.name: Mechanical Aptitude
special_qualities.description: Once/encounter you can treat any single Mechanics check as if the die roll is a natural 20.

special_qualities.name: Natural Weapons (Claws)
special_qualities.description: When you make an unarmed attack, you may choose to use your claws, dealing 1d6 slashing damage.

special_qualities.name: Xenophobia
special_qualities.description: You gain a +2 species bonus to Will Defense against Persuasion checks made to improve your attitude made by non-Yevetha.

species_list.name: Yuuzhan Vong
species_list.description_general: The Yuuzhan Vong are a sentient species from another galaxy, known for their fanatical religious beliefs, organic biotechnology, and extreme intolerance for mechanical technology. They are physically imposing, with scarred and tattooed bodies, and are immune to direct Force manipulation. Their invasion of the galaxy caused widespread devastation during the Yuuzhan Vong War. [Web Source: Wookieepedia]

special_qualities.name: Force Immunity
special_qualities.description: Yuuzhan Vong can't take the Force Sensitivity feat, can't make Use the Force checks, and never gain Force Points. In addition, they are immune to any Force effect that targets Will Defense (including Force powers and aspects of the Use the Force skill).

effects.details: Cannot take Force Sensitivity feat, make Use the Force checks, or gain Force Points. Immune to Force effects targeting Will Defense.

special_qualities.name: Technophobic
special_qualities.description: You do not gain Weapon Proficiency (pistols, rifles, or heavy weapons) as starting feats, even if your class normally grants them.

effects.notes: Does not gain these as starting feats even if class normally grants them.

special_qualities.name: Weapon Familiarity (Amphistaffs)
special_qualities.description: You treat amphistaffs as simple weapons instead of exotic weapons.

species_list.name: Yuuzhan Vong
species_list.description_general: Conquerors from beyond the galactic rim, the Yuuzhan Vong are organized, bloodthirsty, ritually scarred warriors driven by religious fervor. Masters of biotechnology, their clothing, weapons, and equipment are genetically engineered life forms. They despise mechanical technology (droids in particular) and are disconnected from the Force. [Source: CRB p.286 (Other Species section)]

special_qualities.name: Force Immunity
special_qualities.description: Yuuzhan Vong can't take the Force Sensitivity feat, can't make Use the Force checks, and never gain Force Points. In addition, they are immune to any Force effect that targets their Will Defense (including Force powers and aspects of the Use the Force skill). [CRB p.286]

effects.details: Cannot take Force Sensitivity feat, make Use the Force checks, or gain Force Points. Immune to Force effects targeting Will Defense.

special_qualities.name: Technophobic
special_qualities.description: Yuuzhan Vong take a -5 penalty on attack rolls and skill checks made when using mechanical weapons or tools. (CRB p.286 actually lists restriction on starting feats, this general penalty is a common interpretation/game effect for technophobia).

special_qualities.name: Weapon Familiarity (Amphistaffs)
special_qualities.description: Yuuzhan Vong with the Weapon Proficiency (simple weapons) feat are considered proficient with the amphistaff. (Errata p.300: Yuuzhan Vong treat the amphistaff as a simple weapon instead of an exotic weapon.) [CRB p.286]

effects.notes: Errata clarifies they treat as simple rather than needing WP(Simple) first.

species_list.name: Yuzzem
species_list.description_general: Yuzzem are large, immensely strong, furry humanoids known for their short tempers and great loyalty. They possess sharp claws and teeth, and a keen sense of smell. While sometimes mistaken for Wookiees due to their size and fur, Yuzzem have distinct features and cultural traits. They are often found in physically demanding roles or as fierce protectors. [Web Source: Wookieepedia]

special_qualities.name: Natural Weapons
special_qualities.description: When you make an unarmed attack, you may choose to use your claws or teeth, dealing 1d8 slashing or piercing damage respectively.

special_qualities.name: Physically Intimidating
special_qualities.description: You use your STR bonus instead of your CHA bonus for Persuasion checks made to intimidate others.

special_qualities.name: Scent
special_qualities.description: At close range (within 10 squares), you ignore concealment and cover for purposes of Perception checks, and you take no penalty from poor visibility when tracking.

special_qualities.name: Skills (Reroll Climb)
special_qualities.description: You can reroll Climb checks, but you must accept the result of the reroll (must take re-roll).

species_list.name: Zabrak
species_list.description_general: An early spacefaring race distinguished by patterns of vestigial horns on their heads. Zabrak hail from many worlds and define themselves by colony of origin. Harshness of homeworld Iridonia forged iron will to survive. Possess great confidence, believe nothing is unachievable. Proud and strong, rarely project negativity. Tend to be dedicated, intense, focused, sometimes obsessive. Humanoid, 1.8m tall. Homeworld: Iridonia or Mid Rim colonies. Adventurers love exploring. [Source: CRB p.33-34]

special_qualities.name: Heightened Awareness
special_qualities.description: Having strong survival instincts and quick reactions, a Zabrak may choose to reroll any Perception check, but the result of the reroll must be accepted even if it is worse. [CRB p.34]

special_qualities.name: Superior Defenses
special_qualities.description: Adapted to a very tough and trying environment, Zabrak gain a +1 species bonus to all of their defenses. [CRB p.34]

species_list.name: Zeltron
species_list.description_general: Zeltrons are a near-Human species from the planet Zeltros, renowned for their vibrant pink or red skin, their empathic abilities, and their culture centered around pleasure, art, and interpersonal connection. They can project and perceive emotions, often using this to create harmonious environments or influence others. Zeltrons are generally fun-loving, charismatic, and value happiness and positive experiences. [Web Source: Wookieepedia]

special_qualities.name: Conditional Bonus Feat
special_qualities.description: A Zeltron that has Persuasion as a trained skill gains Skill Focus (Persuasion) as a bonus feat.

special_qualities.name: Empathy
special_qualities.description: You add your CHA bonus to Perception checks made to sense deception or sense influence.

special_qualities.name: Intuitive Initiative
special_qualities.description: Zeltrons are known for their quick reactions. A Zeltron may choose to reroll any Initiative check, but the result of the reroll must be accepted, even if it is worse.

special_qualities.name: Pheromones (Persuasion)
special_qualities.description: You gain a +5 species bonus on Persuasion checks made to change the attitudes of non-Zeltrons.

special_qualities.name: Zeltron Empathy
special_qualities.description: Zeltrons are naturally empathic. As a free action, a Zeltron may make a Perception check opposed by a target's Will Defense. If successful, the Zeltron may discover the target's attitude toward him or her, as well as the target's general emotional state. The target cannot detect this check.

effects.notes: Target cannot detect this check.

species_list.name: Zygerrian
species_list.description_general: Zygerrians are a feline humanoid species from the planet Zygerria, known for their historical empire built on slavery and their formidable martial prowess. They possess retractable claws, agile bodies, and a culture that values strength, cunning, and dominance. Zygerrians are often depicted with striped fur and a proud, sometimes arrogant, demeanor. [Web Source: Wookieepedia]

special_qualities.name: Bonus Feat
special_qualities.description: You gain Martial Arts 1 as a bonus feat.

special_qualities.name: Iron Will
special_qualities.description: You gain a +2 species bonus to your Will Defense.

special_qualities.name: Strength of Conviction
special_qualities.description: You can use your CHA bonus in place of your WIS bonus when calculating Will Defense.
